awd_titl_txt: NSF INCLUDES DDLP: BEST BET: Broadening Experiences in Scientific Training - Beginning Enhancement Track
awd_abstract_narration:
The Broadening Experience for Scientific Training: Beginning Enhancement Track ("BEST-BET"), an NSF INCLUDES Design and Development Launch Pilot project, draws upon the expertise of five research-intensive institutions that have developed innovative programing in career and professional development for doctoral and postdoctoral trainees in biomedical research. The goal of the project is to expand the scope and leverage the work so as to engage students earlier in their career exploration. Specifically, the project will target undergraduates who may not be aware of the multitude of career options available to them. These include opportunities in academia, the biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries, science communication, science policy, and technology transfer/patent law. The effort will focus on undergraduates who come from populations generally underrepresented in STEM fields, including but not limited to ethnically, racially and socioeconomically underserved communities. The grant will support educational opportunities for students at minority-serving institutions and will assess the impact of providing new opportunities to this community. The critical contributions of a diverse and inclusive community are essential to progress in all STEM fields. By promoting diversity in education, this project aims to engage undergraduate students at a point in their professional development that could enable participation in a wide range of workforce opportunities so as to advance the progress of science and national health. 

The focus of BEST BET will be to use a collective impact framework to connect the "BEST network" of institutions to partners engaged in undergraduate education of students from underrepresented communities who are interested in the life sciences. The underlying premise is that career exploration focused on opportunities that go beyond physician training will enable engagement of this community of learners in the life science workforce beyond the pre-med track and keep them engaged in degree completion. Multiple strategies will be used to attain the goals of BEST BET. They are organized in the context of two major objectives roughly divided into the scope of planned activities. The first objective focuses on "career exploration" and offers strategies to assist partner institutions to build career and skill development capacities. The second is grounded in an enhanced experience of BEST site visits whereby undergraduates will have the opportunity to envision life as a graduate student and beyond. These strategies will likely enhance persistence to complete the baccalaureate degree and move onto doctoral programs.

por.por_cntn:
The Broadening Experiences in Scientific Training-Beginning Enhancement Track (BEST BET) was an NSF INCLUDES Design and Launch Pilot project.  The overarching vision was to increase awareness of STEM fields through an interactive career development program. It was designed to support and encourage underrepresented (UR) undergraduate students to consider careers in science by increasing awareness of the different career pathways and training opportunities that exist in STEM. The BEST BET project provided programming around career exploration activities that expose students to STEM professionals, various areas of scientific research, and interactive professional development activities that extend beyond what is taught in the classroom to encourage students to see themselves as STEM professionals. 

BEST BET was a collaboration between four research intensive (RI) institutions and four institutions that focus on undergraduate and historically underserved student groups.  The RI institutions represented the BEST consortium (BEST partners) [Boston University (BU); Cornell University; University of Colorado, Denver (CU Denver | Anschutz); University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill (UNC)] and the institutions serving UR students were referred to as the BET partners [Shaw University, University of Massachusetts, Lowell (UML); University of Puerto Rico, Carolina (UPRC) and Xavier University].  The BEST and BET partnerships created capacity for collective action towards enhancing career exposure through partner institution site visits, virtual research lab experiences, digital communication tools, and experiential opportunities to inform UR STEM majors about the various STEM pathways and the critical skills needed to succeed.  

The BEST BET program focused on the transition from undergraduate to doctoral studies and aimed to increase capacity at minority serving institutions (MSIs) to support their students with making informed decisions about career paths.  The BEST-BET program leveraged, translated, and developed unique career and professional development experiences to specifically serve UR STEM undergraduates. BEST BET provided programming for approximately 450 participants (including graduate students, staff and faculty).  BEST BET activities and partnerships provided BET institution faculty/staff with easy-to-use models for designing effective programming and train-the-trainer activities, as well as sustainable career exploration/development strategies for continued programming that extends beyond the BEST BET initiative. Additional BEST BET virtual activities (added to continue programming during the COVID-19 pandemic) helped to reduce common barriers that prevent UR student participation in effective career development activities and networking. Overall, BEST BET tailored programming allowed BET institutions to identify institutional resources that are critical for their students and desired career development, created opportunities for collective impact towards diversifying STEM, and helped to broaden student awareness around STEM career pathways.  

 


Last Modified: 01/05/2023
Modified by: Fadie T Coleman
